title: Pandas: DataFrame Merges
story: Merging (joining) DataFrames is essential for combining data from multiple sources. Learn inner, left, right, and outer joins.
instructions: Perform a left join on two DataFrames using 'id' as the key. df1 has ids [1,2,3] with names, df2 has ids [2,3,4] with scores. Print the merged result.

tests.description: Should merge with NaN for Alice (no matching score)
tests.expectedBehavior: Left join preserves all rows from df1
tests.expected:
id     name  score
0   1    Alice    NaN
1   2      Bob   85.0
2   3  Charlie   90.0

hints.text: Use pd.merge(df1, df2, on='key', how='left') for left join.
Left join keeps all rows from df1. Id 1 has no match in df2, so score is NaN.
